articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Daphne Psaledakis, David Lawder
articles.description: Trump said he would talk with the leaders of Canada and Mexico, which have announced retaliatory tariffs of their own, but downplayed expectations that they would change his mind.
articles.title: Trump says Americans may feel 'pain' in trade war with Mexico, Canada, China

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the policies of U.S. President Donald Trump were pushing Europe to take more responsibility for its own physical and economic security.
articles.title: Russia and Trump push Europe to be more independent, Macron says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: International humanitarian law prohibits the execution of prisoners of war and the wounded, and regards it as a war crime.
articles.title: UN body reports 'alarming rise' in Russian execution of captured Ukrainian soldiers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates are seen by Russia as possible venues for a summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin, two Russian sources with knowledge of the discussions told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Saudi Arabia, UAE seen as possible venues for Trump-Putin summit, two Russian sources say

articles.author: Jaidaa Taha
articles.description: Weeks into the ceasefire in Gaza, thousands of Palestinians who left for neighbouring Egypt are grappling with the question of when they might go home, though they reject the prospect of a mass displacement proposed by U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Gazans in Egypt reject displacement, grapple with decision when to go home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A pro-Russian paramilitary leader from eastern Ukraine, Armen Sarkisyan, was killed when a bomb tore through parts of a luxury apartment block in Moscow, state news agency TASS and other Russian media reported.
articles.title: East Ukrainian paramilitary leader killed in Moscow bomb blast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Greek Ombudsman has recommended disciplinary action against eight coastguard officers for alleged dereliction of duty in one of the deadliest migrant shipwrecks off Greece in which hundreds died in 2023.
articles.title: Greek Ombudsman suggests disciplinary charges over 2023 deadly migrant shipwreck

articles.author: Guillermo Martinez, Michael Gore
articles.description: Spanish women's World Cup winner Jenni Hermoso confronted former soccer federation boss Luis Rubiales at his trial on Monday, saying she did not agree to the kiss that triggered a national backlash against sexism in sport.
articles.title: My boss should not have kissed me, Spain's Hermoso tells Rubiales trials

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A senior commander of Islamic State's Somalia wing was captured on Monday, police and state media said, two days after the IS leadership was targeted with U.S. airstrikes and as security forces continue a weeks-long offensive against them.
articles.title: Senior Islamic State Somalia commander captured in Puntland

articles.author: Michael Holden
articles.description: A British soldier was sentenced to more than 14 years in jail for collecting sensitive information for Iran and gathering the names of special forces personnel before briefly escaping from prison while awaiting trial.
articles.title: Former British soldier jailed for collecting information for Iran
